customer_name: Houston Interactive Aquarium and Animal Preserve
customer_addr:
5440 N Sam Houston Parkway East
Houston, TX 77032

citations.narrative:
Upon review of the inventory during this inspection, it was discovered that on January 7, 2024, an adult Eclectus parrot
escaped through a hole in the top of the black mesh enclosing the aviary. The bird was not recovered. The hole was
formed because of a tear in the black mesh from adverse weather that was experienced that week, whereby the
structures and materials used to enclose the aviary were meant to be in place temporarily. After the course of a week, the
facility determined no other birds escaped through this hole outside of the parakeets mentioned in a previous report.
Inadequate construction and maintenance of a primary enclosure can negatively impact the health, safety and well-being
of the animals enclosed therein. Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they
are structurally sound, kept in good repair, and must be constructed and maintained so that they contain the birds
securely. The facility made temporary repairs to the mesh and other areas that were damaged and are in the process of
making permanent repairs.
Correct by: April 17, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(iii)  Critical Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
Upon review of the inventory during this inspection, it was discovered that on January 7, 2024, an adult Eclectus parrot 
escaped through a hole in the top of the black mesh enclosing the aviary. The bird was not recovered. The hole was 
formed because of a tear in the black mesh from adverse weather that was experienced that week, whereby the 
structures and materials used to enclose the aviary were meant to be in place temporarily. After the course of a week, the 
facility determined no other birds escaped through this hole outside of the parakeets mentioned in a previous report. 
Inadequate construction and maintenance of a primary enclosure can negatively impact the health, safety and well-being 
of the animals enclosed therein. Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they 
are structurally sound, kept in good repair, and must be constructed and maintained so that they contain the birds 
securely. The facility made temporary repairs to the mesh and other areas that were damaged and are in the process of 
making permanent repairs.  
 
Correct by: April 17, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
